item.title: 白银协会称，投资增长将使2026年全球白银需求保持稳定
item.description: 全球白银需求预计在2026年保持稳定，零售投资的增长将抵消工业、珠宝和银器需求的大部分损失，白银协会周二表示。【原文：Global silver demand is expected to remain steady in 2026 with gains in retail investment offsetting most of the losses across industrial, jewellery and silverware demand, the Silver Institute industry association said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 卢特尼克表示，英伟达必须接受其向中国销售人工智能芯片时设置的限制措施。
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克周二在听证会上表示，人工智能芯片公司英伟达在向中国销售其第二先进的AI芯片时，"必须遵守"许可条款。【原文：AI chip company Nvidia "must live with" the licensing terms on sales of its second most advanced AI chip to China, Commerce Department Secretary Howard Lutnick said at a hearing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 特斯拉任命欧洲高管执掌全球销售，彭博社报道
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二报道，知情人士透露，特斯拉已任命其欧洲业务负责人全面负责公司全球销售业务。【原文：Tesla has named its head of European operations to oversee the company's sales globally, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储官员哈马克表示，利率可能在"相当长一段时间内"维持不变
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝·哈马克周二表示，鉴于经济活动前景"谨慎乐观"，美国央行今年没有必要急于调整利率政策。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said on Tuesday the U.S. central bank faces no urgency to change the setting of interest rates this year amid a “cautiously optimistic” outlook for economic activity.】

item.title: 肯尼亚萨法瑞科姆公司开始在其M-Pesa平台上提供股票交易服务
item.description: 肯尼亚电信运营商Safaricom周二在其M-Pesa手机金融平台上推出股票交易服务，此举有望为该国证券交易所引入数百万新的小额投资者。【原文：Kenyan telecoms operator Safaricom on Tuesday launched stock trading for investors on its M-Pesa mobile phone financial platform, a move that could bring millions of new small investors into the bourse.】

item.title: 特斯拉因工会成员秘密录制员工代表会议而提起诉讼，备忘录显示
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份员工备忘录显示，特斯拉已对德国金属工会（IG Metall）的一名成员提起刑事诉讼，指控其在周二柏林附近工厂举行的员工代表会议上进行秘密录音。【原文：Tesla has filed a criminal complaint against a member of Germany's IG Metall trade union for secretly recording a works council meeting that took place at its plant near Berlin on Tuesday, according to a memo to staff seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 欧盟议会支持数字欧元，与理事会就线上线下兼容货币达成一致
item.description: 欧洲议会周二首次对数字欧元给予重大支持，认可了欧洲理事会关于发行兼具线上线下功能的央行数字货币的谈判立场。【原文：The European Parliament gave its first major backing to the digital euro on Tuesday, endorsing the European Council's negotiating stance for a central bank digital currency with both online and offline functionality.】

item.title: 优步在迪拜推出百度自动驾驶出租车服务
item.description: 优步和百度周二宣布，将于下月在迪拜推出自动驾驶网约车服务，这是这家中国科技公司推进全球扩张的最新举措。【原文：Uber and Baidu said on Tuesday they would launch autonomous ride-hailing services in Dubai in the coming month, the latest step in the Chinese tech firm's push toward global expansion.】

item.title: 雅诗兰黛起诉沃尔玛涉嫌销售假冒香水
item.description: 雅诗兰黛周一在加州联邦法院起诉沃尔玛，指控这家零售巨头销售其旗下香水及护肤品牌的仿冒品，涉及品牌包括倩碧、汤姆·福特和Le Labo。【原文：Estee Lauder sued Walmart in California federal court on Monday, accusing the retail giant of selling knockoffs of Estee Lauder fragrance and skin care brands including Clinique, Tom Ford and Le Labo.】

item.title: 派拉蒙为华纳兄弟竞购案增添甜头
item.description: 派拉蒙天空舞影业公司已提升其对华纳兄弟探索公司的收购报价，承诺若交易未能在今年内完成，将按季度追加现金补偿，并同意承担HBO母公司若退出交易需向网飞支付的违约金。【原文：Paramount Skydance has enhanced its Warner Bros Discovery bid by offering extra cash for each quarter the deal fails to close beyond this year and agreeing to cover the breakup fee the HBO owner would owe Netflix if it walked away.】

item.title: 美国提议提高政府资助的电动汽车充电站"购买美国产品"要求
item.description: 美国交通部周二表示，拟将联邦资助的电动汽车充电站中美国本土零部件比例从55%提高至最高100%，此举可能对资金使用构成重大障碍。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said Tuesday it is proposing to boost American-content in federally funded electric vehicle charging stations from 55% to up to 100%, which could pose significant hurdles to use of the funds.】

item.title: 纽约联储称美国家庭信贷问题在2025年末加剧
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行周二发布的一份报告称，美国整体信贷问题在第四季度小幅加剧，部分抵押贷款市场加速恶化，同时学生贷款借款人持续面临困难。【原文：Overall credit troubles in the U.S. increased modestly during the fourth quarter as some parts of the mortgage market saw accelerated fraying, amid ongoing difficulties for student loan borrowers, the New York Federal Reserve said in a report released on Tuesday.】

item.title: 韩国人工智能初创企业Wrtn计划进军美国市场，目标最早于2028年实现首次公开募股（IPO）。
item.description: 韩国初创企业Wrtn创始人表示，该公司已在韩国和日本推出人工智能娱乐服务，预计今年将实现逾1亿美元的年化营收，计划于6月前进军美国市场，并瞄准最早2028年上市。【原文：South Korean startup Wrtn expects to generate more than $100 million of annualised revenue this year after launching its AI entertainment service in South Korea and Japan, with plans to expand to the U.S. by June and eyeing an IPO as early as 2028, its founder said.】

item.title: 微软正探索利用先进电力线路提升数据中心的能源效率
item.description: 微软周二表示，该公司正在探索在其数据中心使用超导输电线路，这有望通过提高能效来加速其在美国大规模建设服务器仓库的进程。【原文：Microsoft is exploring using superconducting power lines in its data centers, which could potentially accelerate its massive U.S. build-out of the server warehouses by making them more energy-efficient, the company said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 波音公司以繁忙的1月开启新一年，交付与订单双丰收
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，1月份共交付46架喷气式飞机，创下该公司历史同期第三高纪录，其中包括38架最畅销的737 MAX客机和5架787梦想客机。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday that it delivered 46 jets in January, the third highest for that month in the company's history, which included 38 of its best-selling 737 MAX jetliners and five 787 Dreamliners.】

item.title: 美国11月商业库存增幅低于预期
item.description: 美国政府周二公布的数据显示，11月美国企业库存增幅低于预期，因零售商库存下降。【原文：U.S. business inventories increased less than expected in November as stocks at retailers fell, government data showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 中国启用人工智能技术，在公共招标中嗅出腐败
item.description: 中国计划在公共招标和投标中运用人工智能技术，以防范幕后交易和腐败行为。周二发布的指导方针显示，此举正值习近平主席持续多年的反腐行动不断加大力度之际。【原文：China wants to use artificial intelligence in public tendering and bidding to guard against backroom deals and corruption, according to guidelines released on Tuesday, just as President Xi Jinping's years-long corruption purge intensifies.】

item.title: 卢特尼克称美国不会阻碍美国企业获取英伟达芯片
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德·卢特尼克周二表示，特朗普政府不会阻碍美国企业获取英伟达设计的高端人工智能芯片。【原文：The Trump administration won't hamper American companies' access to advanced artificial intelligence chips designed by Nvidia , Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家：俄罗斯石油公司在德国的炼油厂警告美国制裁风险
item.description: 据路透社获得的信函显示，德国一家俄资炼油厂的管理层私下警告柏林当局，美国制裁正损害其业务，并威胁到该国首都及周边地区的燃料供应。【原文：Management at a Russian-owned oil refinery in Germany have privately warned Berlin that U.S. sanctions are hurting its business and threatening fuel supply for the country's capital and the region, according to correspondence seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 谷歌以320亿美元收购Wiz，获欧盟反垄断批准
item.description: 谷歌母公司Alphabet周二获得欧盟无条件反垄断批准，以320亿美元收购网络安全公司Wiz。这是谷歌史上最大规模并购案，监管机构表示该交易不会引发任何竞争问题。【原文：Alphabet's Google gained unconditional EU antitrust approval on Tuesday for its $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity company Wiz, its biggest ever deal, after regulators said the deal would not raise any competition concerns.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称，人工智能驱动的软件抛售可能对1.5万亿美元的美国信贷市场构成风险
item.description: 摩根士丹利警告称，人们对人工智能可能颠覆软件行业大部分领域的担忧已开始蔓延至信贷市场。在美国1.5万亿美元贷款市场中，软件行业占比约16%，规模达2350亿美元。【原文：Concerns that artificial intelligence could disrupt large parts of the software industry have started to spill into credit markets, Morgan Stanley warned, as software accounts for about 16%, or $235 billion, of the $1.5 trillion U.S. loan market.】

item.title: 尽管市场担忧人工智能将引发颠覆性变革，软件类股仍创下零售资金流入纪录
item.description: 散户投资者在上周大幅抛售后抢购软件和科技股，基本无视了人工智能模型进步可能颠覆该行业部分领域的担忧。【原文：Retail investors snapped up software and tech stocks following last week's heavy selloff, largely brushing aside worries that advances in artificial-intelligence models could upend parts of the industry.】

item.title: 智利国家铜业公司高管称埃尔滕恩特矿未来五年产量将维持在较低水平
item.description: 智利国家铜业公司（Codelco）埃尔滕恩特矿负责人克劳迪奥·索加雷特周二向路透社表示，该矿去年发生致命事故导致产量受挫，未来五年产量将持续低迷。【原文：Output at Codelco's El Teniente mine, the site of a deadly accident last year that has hit production, will be depressed for about the next five years, mine head Claudio Sougarret told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国电信公司将面临参议员关于电话记录的质询
item.description: 美国司法部检察官获取了八名参议员的电话数据，这些数据与2021年1月6日国会大厦袭击事件的调查有关。美国最大的电信公司将于周二接受参议院质询。【原文：The largest U.S. telecom companies will face Senate questions Tuesday after a Justice Department prosecutor obtained phone data from eight senators related to a probe of the January 6, 2021 Capitol attack.】

item.title: 高盛首席执行官表示，金融赞助商可能推动交易活动增加
item.description: 高盛集团首席执行官大卫·所罗门周二表示，私募股权公司等金融赞助商可能推动交易活动，因为它们在筹集新资金之前面临着向投资者返还资本的压力。【原文：Financial sponsors, such as private equity firms, may bolster dealmaking activity as they come under pressure to return capital to their investors before raising fresh funds, Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国12月进口价格同比持平
item.description: 美国劳工部劳工统计局周二表示，12月美国进口价格同比持平，此前11月下降0.1%。【原文：U.S. import prices were unchanged on a year-on-year basis in December after falling 0.1% in November, the Labor Department's Bureau of Labor Statistics said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 派拉蒙以额外现金及承担网飞解约费提升对华纳兄弟的收购报价
item.description: 派拉蒙与天空舞影业已提高对华纳兄弟探索公司的收购报价，将每股收购价从30美元上调。新方案规定：若交易未能按季度完成，将额外支付现金补偿；同时承诺承担HBO母公司若终止与网飞协议需支付的违约金。【原文：Paramount Skydance has enhanced its $30-per-share bid for Warner Bros Discovery by offering extra cash for each quarter the deal fails to close and agreeing to cover the breakup fee the HBO owner would owe Netflix if it walked away from their deal.】

item.title: 艾科朗公司预测2026年利润将超预期，得益于强劲需求
item.description: 埃科乐公司周二预测本年度利润将超出华尔街预期，因其业务板块的增长将推动对清洁、消毒及冷却等技术与服务的需求。【原文：Ecolab on Tuesday forecast current-year profit above Wall Street estimates, as it expects growth in its business segments to drive demand for its technologies and services that include cleaning, sanitization and cooling.】

item.title: 美国劳动力成本增速在第四季度放缓
item.description: 美国劳动力成本增速在第四季度意外放缓，导致年度增幅创下四年半以来最低水平，因劳动力需求疲软抑制了工资增长。【原文：Growth in U.S. labor costs unexpectedly slowed in the fourth quarter, leading to the smallest annual increase in 4-1/2 years, as softening demand for labor restrained wage gains.】

item.title: 得州将"觉醒"的黑石列入黑名单的法案遭否决，或将挑战其他州反ESG法案
item.description: 分析人士称，得克萨斯州一名法官推翻该州一项将采用环境、社会或治理因素进行投资决策的"觉醒"金融机构（包括贝莱德和汇丰银行）列入黑名单的法律的举动，很可能推动其他州更广泛地废除所谓的"反ESG"法律。【原文：A Texas judge's move to strike down a state law blacklisting "woke" financial firms, including BlackRock and HSBC, that used environmental, social or governance factors in investment decisions will likely drive a broader push to repeal so-called "anti-ESG" laws in other states, analysts said.】
